alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 01 at 2:35PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, except 2 to 3 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, with up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds may cause tree damage and lead to some power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall may continue into Tuesday, becoming lighter and more showery in nature.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
